title: The Sweetness of Obedience
devotional:
Eliza loved baking. Every Sunday, the aroma of her cinnamon rolls would fill the little church hall after service. People lined up, not just for the sweet treat, but for Eliza's warm smile and encouraging words. One year, the church decided to hold a fundraising bake sale, aiming to replace the aging roof. Eliza, naturally, volunteered to bake. However, the pastor gently asked if she might consider baking pies instead. Pies, he explained, sold for a higher price, and the church desperately needed to maximize its profits.

Eliza hesitated. She'd never been confident with pies. Her crusts were always too thick, the fillings either too runny or burnt. Cinnamon rolls were her specialty, her offering to God. Baking pies felt like stepping outside her comfort zone, an act of obedience she wasn't sure she could pull off.

For days, Eliza wrestled with the request. Was God asking her to step aside from what she was good at, to embrace a challenge for the sake of the church? She prayed, read scripture, and finally, with a deep breath, agreed. The next week was a whirlwind of new recipes, burnt crusts, and flour-dusted chaos. She called her grandmother, watched online tutorials, and spent hours experimenting. It wasn't easy, but Eliza persevered.

On the day of the bake sale, Eliza stood proudly behind her display of apple, pumpkin, and pecan pies. They weren't perfect, but they were made with love, sweat, and a whole lot of prayer. To her surprise, the pies sold out within an hour! People raved about the homemade goodness, the flaky crust, and the delicious fillings. The bake sale exceeded its fundraising goal, and the church got its new roof.

Eliza learned a valuable lesson that day: obedience often requires stepping outside our comfort zones, embracing challenges, and trusting that God will equip us for the task. Sometimes, the greatest blessings come when we surrender our own preferences and follow God's lead, even when it seems difficult or unfamiliar.
image_description: An assortment of freshly baked pies sitting on a wooden table, bathed in soft, natural light from a nearby window. A rolling pin rests casually to the side, dusted with flour.
insights: Eliza's story reflects the biblical principle of obedience found throughout scripture. 1 Samuel 15:22 states, 'Does the Lord delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obeying the Lord’s voice? To obey is better than sacrifice, and to heed is better than the fat of rams.' This verse highlights that outward acts of service are meaningless without a heart of obedience. Jesus, in John 14:15, also emphasized the importance of obedience as a sign of love for God: 'If you love me, you will keep my commandments.'
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often struggle with obedience, clinging to my own preferences and avoiding challenges. Help me to surrender my will to Yours and to embrace the path You have set before me, even when it seems difficult or unfamiliar. Grant me the strength and courage to step outside my comfort zone, trusting that You will equip me for the task. Teach me to hear Your voice and to obey Your commands with a willing heart. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life are you being called to obedience? What fears or insecurities are holding you back from surrendering your will to God? How can you cultivate a heart of obedience, seeking God's guidance and trusting in His provision?
